body.name: NUK Smooth Flow Anti Colic Baby Bottle, 10 oz, 3 Pack, Elephant

features: Unique smooth flow bottle nipple design allows baby to control the speed of the flow of milk for colic-free feeding
SafeTemp Indication: thermometer icon on bottle changes color when milk is too hot
Accepted by 98% of babies, based on market research, 2019, tested with 145 bottle users
Bottle nipple mimics the shape of mom's nursing nipple during breastfeeding, for a smooth transition from breast to bottle and back
Wide neck bottle is easy to clean and dishwasher safe
body.description: NUK Smooth Flow Bottles are the anti-colic solution for bottle feeding, featuring a unique nipple design that allows baby to control the flow rate for colic-free feeding. This Smooth Flow nipple adjusts the flow based on how your baby drinks, adapting to their suction strength to ensure they will always have the right flow rate. The SafeTemp temperature indicator lets you know when milk is too hot with just a glance. The blue thermometer indicator fades when milk is too hot and reappears when milk has cooled and is safe to drink.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About Us First and foremost, understanding life means being mindful of the needs of those who are most important to us: children. We research their different stages of development at every age and improve our products accordingly. All NUK products build upon each other – so you can always be sure of doing the right thing for your child - right from the start. From birth to kindergarten: They have only just been born and already they are trying to tell us what they need: babies. We would like to understand what babies require right from day one. The needs of three month old infants are different to those of eight month old babies who are battling with their first tooth. Only if we examine and completely understand every stage of development can we always come up with the right solutions for babies and children. Our products build upon each other and grow with your child – from birth to kindergarten. Children turn everything on its head. And new parents have thousands of new questions. We know this and want to help parents in their new role. With products, which help children’s development and make the everyday lives of mothers and fathers easier.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My 2 month old loved this bottle as soon as I gave it to her

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best bottles for formula fed baby
reviews.reviewText: My baby is formula fed and deals with a lot of gas pains so a good bottle is a must for her. We have tried almost all brands out there with her and the Nuk bottles have worked the best. They are really easy to clean, dry, and assemble back together because they only have 4 parts (cap, nipple, rim, bottle). It is a light weight bottle so holding on to it while baby feeds is convenient. Also, out of all the bottles we have tried, the nipple on the Nuk bottles have worked the best. Not only does my baby properly latch without spilling but it keeps her from eating too fast. The nipple also has a small hole were trapped air can escape which is great for gassy babies to not take in as much air between feedings. In addition, the bottle itself has a blue temperature line that turn white when the milk or bottle is too hot and does a great job at indicating when the temperature is ok for baby by turning blue again when it’s a safe level. The Nuk bottles have worked so well for use that we have bought a total of 5 sets and only have to wash them once a day or two depending on how much baby girl eats any given day (we feed on demand). Definitely recommend based on quality and value!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars they're good bottles but you have to understand how feeding works
reviews.reviewText: I see a lot of these reviews and think that people are perhaps misunderstanding how breastfeeding and bottle-feeding vary among infants. Every baby is different, every mouth is different, every breast is different, and every latch is unique. A bottle that works for my baby may not work for yours, but that doesn't mean the bottle is bad. You may have to try a few before finding the right one.I like this bottle for us. My baby is a pretty easy feeder and has good suction. We wanted bottles that would let him feed slowly. These work well for that. They've helped us minimize spit up. For us, these worked better than the Tommee Tippee or Avent or Dr. Brown. Definitely make sure you get the right size nipple, though!If you want some advice from my genius lactation doctor... One of the best things you can do with bottle feeding is just go slow. Really slow. Breastfeeding is not an instant or fast process for babies. It takes a minute for milk to let down, the flow changes throughout the feed, there are starts and stops in the process, etc. If you're testing out a new bottle, try to imitate that process. Give the baby the bottle, but don't immediately let the milk flow to the nipple. Take breaks if your baby allows it, and if not, incline them a bit so they're not getting a full flow. Do some gentle burps. Maybe change their diaper in the middle of the feed rather than right before. If you do that, you'll get a good idea of how well the bottle is working AND, bonus, when you breastfeed, you'll have a baby accustomed to a normal pace so they won't get frustrated at how slow the process is!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My son loves Mickey Mouse ,but
reviews.reviewText: The flow a lil to fast , I have brought these before just a different style and for some reason the 5oz flow 9oz vs these oz seem to throw my baby off . I know most times when he extremely hungry it’ll happen ,but when he’s not sometimes he’ll choke . He has his days but it’s not often . I also use cereal in his bottle , so if you only using milk pls make sure you’re baby can handle the flow . The Y shape is made for cereal bottles .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Bottles are great for supplementing breast feeding, as far as bottles go that I have tried anyway.. and I love that they say rose and are pink!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Product seemed used.
reviews.reviewText: Upon opening the package and inspecting the bottles, I noticed light scratches on the bottle already. I was very hesitant to use it but the box did say "New" on the label. I made sure to give it a good wash and sanitized in hot boiling water before using. The plastic part that holds the nipple in feels cheaply made and cant get a good grip on it when trying to open and close the bottle. I'm not sure if it's smooth controlled flow, I tried the first bottle with my son and it came way too fast which I thought he was probably just got to get use to it. Second bottle same thing, flow came too fast, I squeezed the top of the bottle nipple of the Y shape and milk came pouring out. Not sure if we will use it again since he is only 4 months. We will have to wait until he is older and can drink at a faster flow to use it.

My son who is 18 months will only drink cow milk from these bottles(i am trying to wean him off the breast). He loves the Nuk pacifiers so I thought I would give these bottles a try and sure enough he took to them happily. They don't leak like some people say, they have truly been a great help in our transition!
El producto es muy lindo y de excelente calidad
Es el producto que esperaba, una gran satisfacción al recibir lo que pedí, recomiendo la compra de este producto ampliamante.
The platic used to make the nipple is too hard which creates difficulty in latching for my infant. Milk leaks out of the anti-colic valve.
The item looks exactly like in the photos? Have been using NUK and love them. They are also smarter to have better bottle covers that doesn’t leak when turned upside down.
